item.title: Trump to Notify Countries of US Tariffs Up to 70%, Russia Launches Strikes on Kyiv | The Pulse 07/04
item.description: US President Donald Trump said his administration will probably start notifying trading partners Friday of the new US tariff on their exports effective Aug. 1, while reiterating a preference for simplicity over complicated negotiations five days before his deadline for deals. Trump told reporters that about “10 or 12” letters would go out Friday, with additional letters coming “over the next few days.” Elsewhere, Russia unleashed a record air strike on Ukraine, as President Trump expressed disappointment over the outcome of his latest phone call with Vladimir Putin aimed at bringing an end to the war. Today's guests, Nataliia Lipikhina, JP Morgan Private Bank EMEA Equity Strategy Head, Omotunde Lawal, Barings EMEA Corporate Credit & EM Corporate Debt Head, Elisabeth Braw, Atlantic Council Senior Fellow, Francois Villeroy de Galhau, Banque de France Governor. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Hong Kong Moves to Defend FX Peg for Third Time in a Week
